advancement.geomancy.main.description: A world of buried treasures and wonders
advancement.geomancy.main.name: Geomancy
advancement.geomancy.main.simple_duplica: Try and fail to equip two artifacts of the same type at once
advancement.geomancy.main.simple_tried_t: You need to smack the smithery with a hammer to start crafting
book.geomancy.guidebook.main.deepslate.i: I have discovered these polished deepslate blocks in some of those ruins. Some of them bear ancient symbols and sigils. I wonder what they mean.
book.geomancy.guidebook.main.deepslate.s: It's skillfully adorned with glittering gold.
It appears to display various tools, weapons, and treasure.
book.geomancy.guidebook.main.entry.intro:
There exist ruins in this world, ruins of ancient deepslate and inscriptions of rare metals.
What do they mean? I will write down my findings in this book.
book.geomancy.guidebook.main.entry.name: Discovery
Fascinating. I'm not used to finding fluids other than water or lava... yet here's some molten gold.
What is equally as fascinating is that the only places I've found it in seem to be these ruins... How has it not resolidified after all these years?
book.geomancy.guidebook.main.gold.name: Molten Gold
book.geomancy.guidebook.main.gold.spotli: I doubt I'll be able to dip my apples or carrots in it...
book.geomancy.guidebook.main.mithril.int: This incredibly rare metal is impressively durable for its light weight. It shines with a bright white color. I can sense that there is more to it than tools and armor.
book.geomancy.guidebook.main.mithril.spo: It is also definitely not edible.
book.geomancy.guidebook.main.name: Discovery
book.geomancy.guidebook.name: Notes on Minerals
book.geomancy.guidebook.tooltip: we can never dig too deep
item.geomancy.iron_hammer.desc: Can be used to smith items
item.geomancy.mithril_hammer.desc: Can be used to smith items
